note.p: Birth: Bollington, near Macclesfield, Cheshire, England (20 October 1891)
Death: Cambridge (24 July 1974)
Research Field: Physics
Education: PhD
Career: Fellow of Gonville and Caius College, Cambridge, and Assistant Director of Radio-Active Research in the Cavendish Laboratory
Honours: Kt 1945; CH 1970
Membership: Fellow
Election Date: 12/05/1927
Medals/Prizes: Hughes Medal 1932; Copley Medal 1950; Nobel Prize (Physics) 1935
Lectures: Bakerian 1933; Rutherford 1953
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DSB vol 17 pp 143-148
Obituaries: Biographical Memoirs of Fellows of the Royal Society 1976 vol 22 pp 11-70, plate, by Sir Harrie Massey and N Feather
References: J R Holt, 'James Chadwick at Liverpool' in NR 1994 vol 48 pp 299-308
